snippet: In the Legislature’s annual two-month session, opening this week, the Senate is to take up a bill asking voters to decide on gambling.
abstract: Florida Legislature will vote on contentious bill to allow resort casinos in the state as it meets for annual two-month session; casinos are seen by some as powerful tool to plug a $2 billion budget deficit, but critics say industry will tarnish state's wholesome beach-and-theme-park image.

byline.contributor: Christine Sexton contributed reporting from Tallahassee, Fla.

lead_paragraph: In the Legislature’s annual two-month session, opening this week, the Senate is to take up a bill asking voters to decide on gambling.

headline.main: In Florida, Lawmakers Consider Gambling Bill
headline.print_headline: In Florida, Lawmakers Consider Gambling Bill
